data.title: An amazing Stay!
data.text: I have to say that our stay at Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh was more than I could imagine. The staff was incredibly attentive and made our anniversary wonderful. The rooms were very comfortable, the living room happy hour was great, and the Commoner was incredible! Couldn't have had a nicer stay :)

data.title: Steeler's vs Cowboy's game
data.text: Stayed here three nights.  We flew in from Fort Worth for the game!  This hotel was awesome!  The front desk help was awesome, they even greeted us with local beer.  The decor was very cool!  The rooms nice and big and really comfortable.  The only negative was that our room did not have great water pressure in the shower.  It was fine but I would have liked a little more power.   We requested a coffee pot and they brought us one.  The room decor was awesome!  Not the same old boring chain hotel feel!   I want to come back and bring my kids to a Pirate game!   We would stay here!   Walking distance to the strip district, casino, Heinz and PNC!  Plenty to do nearby!  They have free drinks from 5-6 but we were never in the room for that but they did greet us after the game with an Ice Cold beer!  Fox Sports was also staying here and my husband had a quick chat with Troy Aikmen!  This place is doing things right.  If you need a tooth brush or a whole list of items, they will give you one and the sign says, if we don't have what you need, we will go find it for you!   Great Job!  Loved this hotel. I loved the bird cage light fixture!  So cool!

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dalestacy - Thanks for the amazing review! I'm thrilled that you had such a wonderful time at the game this past weekend. From the décor to the free beer, we try our best to stand-out and make game day a little extra fun. My apologies about the water pressure. I will pass the feedback along to our Engineering staff immediately. We would love to see you all for a Pirates game! Hopefully, we can host you again soon!

Thanks again, 
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Sports weekend
data.text: Stayed 3 nights.  Rooms are very colorful.  Smaller size.  Bathrooms are tastefully decorated. White and grey marble.  The staff is amazing.  The commoner, restaurant inside hotel, has amazing desserts.  Would stay again.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Aletta B - Thank you for the great review! I'm glad you enjoyed our aesthetic and had pleasant interactions with the staff here. We hope to host you again soon for your next big weekend away!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good, but not as great as past Kimpton stays
data.text:
I adore the Kimpton properties throughout the country, so was quite excited to give this one a try. While it definitely included some of the things I loved, it wasn't quite up to par with my past experiences.  

Pros:  The location in downtown is a good one.  Room décor was eclectic, fun and clean.  Bed was pretty comfy (a little firmer than I like).  I always love that it's dog friendly.  Nice to have the mini bar/snacks available.  Agree with other reviews that complimentary water would be a nice touch, but not all hotels will do this. And who doesn't love wine hour!   Nice to have the Commoner restaurant conveniently attached as well.

Cons:  The staff was just not as bright and friendly as I've experienced at past Kimptons.  Polite and efficient, yes....but no warmth or personal touch.   I stayed for 3 nights and found this lack of real friendliness throughout from the front desk to the bellman/valet folks.   Also, I was not prepared for the parking challenges....you more or less need to valet as there is no hotel lot (for a fee that I was not expecting), and give 30 minutes notice to obtain your car...makes for inconvenient coming and going.   I realize that downtown Pittsburgh parking is a challenge outside of their control, I just wasn't prepared for this inconvenience.   Finally, my room was on the side opposite the entrance (low #s), and the view was literally into the windows of the building next door and you couldn't even really get a glimpse of daylight as the buildings are very close.  Again, it is what it is, but staying there for 3 nights with no light from outside was a little depressing.  Try to avoid that side when obtaining your room. 

All in all, it was a super nice, fresh property, certainly more modern and updated than other hotels in the city...and I'd stay again (hopefully on a less dreary side of the building)...but hope that the staff can step up the warmth factor a bit.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
erin_mn4 - Thanks for the kind words! My apologies that you didn't find the staff to be as friendly as those you've encountered at other Kimpton Properties. This is not indicative of the service we hope to provide, and I hope we get another chance to knock it out of the park on your next visit. Please let me know next time you're in town, and we'll make sure that stay is your best yet!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Funky decor, interesting but not comfortable
data.text: If you want 'unique' the Monaco is for you. If you want desks, chairs and rooms that are comfortable, then it is not. The communal spaces are all equally funky and very noisy. There's no place to simply relax. That being said, the staff all attempted to be very helpful. The bottom line is that the Monaco is nice, but not for everybody!

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
DRWMETMAN - Thanks for the feedback. I'm sorry that your recent stay wasn't as relaxing as you hoped. If you do decide to give us another try, please reach out beforehand so I can personally ensure a more relaxing stay! 

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: High energy in the heart of downtown Pittsburgh
data.text: Hotel Monaco set the tone for a lively weekend getaway to Pittsburgh to visit our son who is in grad school at CMU.  Rooms were fresh and decor eclectic in a fun way, staff most congenial, and there is a warm buzzy vibe throughout the hotel.  The happy hour each evening is a nice draw, and the restaurant is hopping at all hours.  All in all, a wonderful experience!

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
gko2014 - Thanks for the great review! I'm glad we could make your recent weekend visit a little more fun. I hope we have the opportunity to provide another wonderful experience in the near future!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The perfect place to stay in Pittsburgh!!!!
data.text:
What a great jewel in the middle of downtown Pittsburgh! 
Walking distance to EVERYTHING! From the moment you pull up, the valets were helpful; the front desk was welcoming...thanks to Marissa, John G and Brittany. A nice note in our room from Whitney and Emily made it feel like we are truly appreciated for choosing the hotel. Alex at the bar in The Commoner was engaging! So many nice little touches from the glass of wine in the upstairs common area to the salt bath! Moms don't usually take the time to spoil themselves...the Hotel Monaco took the time to do just that! Highly recommend this hotel!!!!

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Anne H - Thanks for the perfect review! We're super grateful for the kind words and are thrilled that you had such a great stay. Hopefully you will have the chance to treat yourself again soon! We'd love to see you.

Thanks again, 
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun & funky decor but left feeling very tired
data.text: We booked our stay at Hotel Monaco last minute for a 1 night kid free getaway to celebrate my birthday. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the super friendly staff with hard cider samples from a local brewery which I thought was a fun touch. Also fun, they had a complimentary wine & beer gathering in the common area at 5pm. The room was awesome and the bedding was very comfortable. We did however not get the full night of sleep that we desperately had hoped for being that we were without our young kids. We stayed on the 5th floor facing the back of the property which was directly next to the neighboring church. Since it was Sunday morning, I swear that those church bells were ringing every half hour throughout the morning. Needless to say we did not need a wake up call. If staying on a Sunday morning I suggest asking for a room facing the front of the property to avoid the bells. But all in all it was a fun stay.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Worldtravelerang - Thanks for the great review! I'm glad that you had such a fun trip though I was sorry to hear about your sleeping troubles. Please let me know the next time you're staying with us so I can make sure you have a good night's rest. I hope we have the opportunity to host you again soon! 

Thanks again, 
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A lovely and super accommodating stay!
data.text: My husband and 2 kids and I just stayed at the Pittsburgh Hotel Monaco this past weekend because I was attending a 25th year reunion for my women's soccer team at Carnegie Mellon University.  Everything from Jessie, who was able to speak to me over the phone about my trip (I was initially a bit concerned that my kids wouldn't have anything to do with their babysitter while there for a night), to the cleanliness of the hotel and great housekeeping to the fantastic restaurant downstairs, I think it was called The Common?, was superb.  Jessie was able to make several recommendations for things to do nearby with kids.  He even took my kids names and said he would be able to help make their stay comfortable.  When we arrived (about 5 1/2 hrs early), they gave them each cardboard airplanes and coloring books, which they totally appreciated!  And, they also followed through on their promise to provide a personal goldfish in the room!  So cool!  And they even provided some free snacks and water bottles, which we definitely appreciated!  I will definitely be going back here next time we go visit Pittsburgh, and any other city that happens to have a Hotel Monaco!

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Jocelyn V. - Thanks for the amazing review! I'll make sure to pass along your kind words to Jesse. He rocks, doesn't he? I'm pumped that you had such a rad stay with us. We look forward to seeing you again next time you're in town. You can let us know about the other Kimpton Properties you've checked out since you're last visit though we hope we're still your favorite!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Charming and lovely hotel
data.text:
I spent 5 Night in The hotel, so nice rooms, very comfortable bed, friendly staff / everything was so good. I can only recommend the hotel!
The kitchen in the restaurant was very good, and the bar was whit good cocktails and lots of fun

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
fb1114673231- Thanks for the great review. I'm happy to hear that you had such a wonderful stay with us and appreciate the recommendation. I hope you get to come back for some more fun soon!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awesome hotel
data.text: We LOVED this hotel.  It is so quirky and delightful.  I had a smile on my face the whole time we were there.  We stayed after visiting Falling Water (amazing!) and were going to stay at the Sheraton. Soooo happy we didn't.  This is so much better.  Our room was great (it had one of the birdcage lamps which I just loved) with a very comfy bed and lovely linens.  All the staff were delightful and went out of their way to help us.  It's in the centre of downtown so lots of places to check out/ eat at.  We took an Uber car to ShadySide which if you like architecture is a lovely place to walk around with lots of cafes and bars.  All in all it was an awesome stay and Pittsburgh had a great vibe.  Loved it.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
NYKiwi - We loved your review:) Thanks for the kind words. I'm glad you had such a great stay with us, and it sounds like you got to experience quite a bit of the 'Burgh. We look forward to making some new suggestions on your next visit!

Come again soon,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable and Funky
data.text: This is a great hotel. The rooms were quite large. The beds were very comfortable. The decorative items were quirky and fun, and there is a happy hour from 5 to 6.   Additionally, the restaurant, The Commoner, was great for brunch.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Beth P. - Thanks for the great review! I'm glad you enjoyed our rooms and were able to check-out our complementary wine hour. It does tend to make things more festive. I hope we have the opportunity to host you again soon!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Charming, Friendly Boutique Hotel in a Fabulous Location
data.text: We spent two nights here and loved the location and the ambiance of this hotel.  The décor is charming.  Our room was comfortable and roomy with lovely amenities.   The restaurant/bar is a fun spot.  We look forward to returning to once again walk the streets of this quaint neighborhood in downtown Pittsburgh.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
oliviaone - Thanks for charming review!  I'm thrilled that you enjoyed our hotel so much. Hopefully, we have the chance to see you again soon!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Adorable chic hotel in the heart of Pittsburgh
data.text: We loved this hotel, from the quirky decor to the delicious cocktails served at The Commoner bar. Staff was very friendly and the hotel is pet-friendly which is always convenient. We are anxiously awaiting our next trip to Pittsburgh to stay here again.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Claire G - Thank you so much for the awesome review! Quirky Décor and Delicious Cocktails are two impressions that we love to leave so I'm glad you enjoyed both. We can't wait to see you again! 

Best Wishes,
john Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Soooo Comfortable!!
data.text: The room was so comfortable, the service was amazing and the staff so nice! I really liked the downstairs restaurant, and the lounge they have right upstairs from the front desk. I really recommend staying here, the location is also so very good, walking distance from Heinz Field!!

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Maru H. -Thanks for the awesome review. I glad that you had a super comfortable stay, and I'll make sure to pass along you kind words to everybody here. Stop by again soon!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very nice and hip hotel
data.text: The hotel is happening, the bistro is very busy although the food is not top notch. The rooms were wonderful, very clean and nicely decorated. The staff was very child friendly and helpful with things.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
OurCoolFamilyofSix - Thanks for the kind words. I apologize that we your meal wasn't the best it could have been. If you would like to reach out to me, I would love an opportunity to make things right. I appreciate the generous feedback about the rooms and our staff. I hope we have a chance to host you again soon!

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not worth the price
data.text: Don't get me wrong, the rooms are nice, comfortable and clean, but the price is wrong.  That the website suggest that any of these rooms have any kind of 'view' is misleading.  The location is great for a downtown visit.  Parking is stupid expensive and there are clearly other hotels that would just as nice for quite a bit less.

owner_response.author: , Front Office Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
TrevorNYC_11 - Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I am sorry if the view from your room was underwhelming. We do have limited views due to the fact that we are in the heart of downtown. We hope you come back and give us another try! 

Have a great day!

Warm Regards,
Jesse
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fabulous service, fabulous location, fabulous boutique hotel and restaurant. Just Fab!
data.text: Booked this hotel for 2 nights as a surprise for my husbands birthday along with tickets to the Steelers game. It was better than I expected, our room (915) was in a quiet location of the property as I requested and was worth waiting to check in at 3pm, they were busy because of the football game that day. We loved the location, right downtown and around the corner from the "T" subway, easy to get to Heinz Field or anywhere else downtown and it was free, Wow what's free anymore? The decor is very colourful and eclectic which we appreciated, comfortable beds, nice robes, in room safe, nice bathroom with shower only. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable. We really loved The Commoner Restaurant in the hotel too, we had 3 meals in 2 days and the food was well prepared with quality ingredients, the prices were reasonable. Would recommend this hotel in Pittsburg, it lives up to its good reviews.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
lindawatts61 - Thanks for the fabulous review! I'm thrilled that everything worked out so well for your husband's big birthday surprise. We appreciate the recommendation and hope to host you for many more happy times!

Thanks again, 
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful Hotel
data.text: This hotel is the best hotel experience I've had in a long time. It's a unique boutique hotel in the center of the city in Pittsburgh. Walking distance to some cool places and the park. We loved it here.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review

John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Elegant trendy hotel in the heart of Pittsburgh
data.text: Stunning decor and lots of extras like loaner bicycles, umbrellas and yoga mats in each room, proximity keys, and large closet. Great location with most of downtown in walking distance. Very close to convention center.

owner_response.author: , Manager at Kimpton Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
MEDS144 - Thank you so much for the kind words! I hope you had a chance to utilize the bicycles during your stay. The trails are lovely to bike through this time of year. I hope we see you again on your next trip to Pittsburgh.

Thanks again,
John Gleason
owner_response.title: Owner Response
